definition: to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: Still, I shook with a mixture of aloneness and terror.
sentences.chinese: 但是我依舊瑟瑟發抖，因爲我孤立無援，充滿恐懼。

sentences.english: At this moment it suddenly occurred to him how completely alone they were.
sentences.chinese: 他突然意識到他們此刻多麼地孤立無援。

sentences.english: Custom hedged her in and made her helpless.
sentences.chinese: 習慣勢力限制了她並使她孤立無援。

sentences.english: Impoverished, war-weary Africans locally are on their own.
sentences.chinese: 貧困，厭戰的非洲人孤立無援。

sentences.english: On many of these populist measures, France is isolated.
sentences.chinese: 在許多民粹主義的舉措上，法國孤立無援。

sentences.english: Piteous , helpless, animal groans came from the next room.
sentences.chinese: 從門後可以聽見悲慘的孤立無援的動物的呻吟。

sentences.english: "The quilombo movement is still very timid, " Pinto said.
sentences.chinese: ‘歌倫波’運動仍然是孤立無援的，”Pinto說。

sentences.english: To believe is to know we are not alonge.
sentences.chinese: 信念就是明白我們並非孤立無援。

sentences.english: Ume's work travels around the world in gallery shows, but performs just as well as stand-alone photographs sent around as Internet gags.
sentences.chinese: 她的作品遍佈世界，卻在互聯網的世界裏孤立無援。

sentences.english: He doesn't bring you out on a limb and then cut off the limb.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有把你帶到孤立無援的窘境，而又把後路切斷。

definition: to look up and see no-one familiar (idiom); not having anyone to rely on/without a friend in the world
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
